title.narrative: FUNCTIONAL GOVERNANCE SYSTEM FOR THE PROVISION OF QUALITY, RELEVANT EDUCATION.

description.narrative: The education sector has a functional governance system for the provision of quality, relevant education., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys, in particular the most marginalized and those affected by humanitarian crises, are provided with inclusive and equitable qualityeducation and learning opportunities.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The education sector has a functional governance system for the provision of quality, relevant education.

description.narrative: UNICEF has supported work to improve the governance of the education sector through coordination, policy dialogue and policy development. It has also supported work on the harmonization, production, accessibility and use of education data. This was achieved through co-chairing the education sector working group, organizing the joint sector review, monitoring the GPE-funded ESPIG for year 1, and supporting the integration of EMIS and rollout of TMIS, as well as the pilot of the GIGA initiative to connect 43 out of 63 schools to the internet. ; ;; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2021
